{{cpp/title|full_extent|full_extent_t}}
{{cpp/container/mdspan/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header|mdspan}}
{{dcl|num=1|since=c++26|1=
struct full_extent_t { explicit full_extent_t() = default; };
}}
{{dcl|num=2|since=c++26|1=

}}
{{dcl end}}

@1@ The class {{tt|std::full_extent_t}} is a slice specifier type that can be used in {{lc|std::submdspan}}.

@2@ The corresponding {{tt|std::full_extent}} instance of {{v|1}} is a slice specifier to indicate full range of indices in the specified extent in {{lc|std::submdspan}}.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;mdspan&gt;
#include &lt;print&gt;

void print(auto view)
{
    static_assert(view.rank() &lt;= 2);

    if constexpr (view.rank() == 2)
    {
        for (std::size_t i = 0; i != view.extent(0); ++i)
        {
            for (std::size_t j = 0; j != view.extent(1); ++j)
                std::print("{} ", view[i, j]);
            std::println();
        }
    }
    else if constexpr (view.rank() == 1)
    {
        for (std::size_t i = 0; i != view.extent(0); ++i)
            std::print("{} ", view[i]);
        std::println();
    }
    else
        std::println("{}", view[]);

    std::println();
}

int main()
{
    const char letters []{'A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G', 'H', 'I'};
    const std::mdspan view(letters, 3, 3);

    print(view);
    print(std::submdspan(view, std::full_extent, std::full_extent));
    print(std::submdspan(view, std::full_extent, 1));
    print(std::submdspan(view, 1, std::full_extent));
    print(std::submdspan(view, 2, 1));
}
|p=true
|output=
A B C
D E F
G H I

A B C
D E F
G H I

B E H

D E F

H
}}
